creator: jboynes@apache.org
text:
WebXml has two ways of detecting the version of the web application. 

setPublicId() handles all versions but only actually needs to deal with the DTD-based descriptors (2.2 and 2.3).

setVersion() treats the version attribute as a numeric value and parse out major and minor based on decimal values. However, each version of the spec defines a literal String that could be matched directly instead. It also only needs to handle XSD-based descriptors (2.4 and later).

As a minor note, the string id "webxml.unrecognisedPublicId" is inconsistent with other values (it has a lower case X)

creator: markt@apache.org
text: Thanks. This has beeen fixed in trunk based on the larger patch you submitted for bug 55166. It will be included in 8.0.x.
